availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, and Paris, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, and soldier. Native of Bavaria. Son of Samuel Hollander and Rebecca Hollander. Married to Rebecca Hollander. Father of Samuel Hollander. Clothing merchant in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1860. Farmer in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1863. Proprietor of a shoe store in Paris, Kentucky, in 1864. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 5, p. 415.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 14, p. 271A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 7th Congressional District, Bourbon County, July 1863, p. 72 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0118.
Find A Grave, "Herman Hollander (1837-1891)," Memorial #185210075, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/185210075 (accessed May 11, 2020).
